title: The Intelligence; “There's a lot of warranted scepticism about his economic plans”—meeting Brazil's presidential front-runner
text:
LUIZ INÁCIO LULA DA SILVA, a leftist former president, looks well-placed to win a third term. But which Lula would Brazil get—the fiscal conservative or the populist spendthrift? Germany has an earned reputation as an industrial powerhouse, but its dependence on Russian gas and Chinese demand are hobbling it. And why the propaganda-spewing loudspeakers in Vietnam's capital are firing up again. Runtime: 27 min

Listen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneIn
